newsitem.title: USA: Informix wins $30 mln government contract.
newsitem.headline: Informix wins $30 mln government contract.

text.p: Informix Software Inc said Monday that it has won a contract valued at $30 million over ten years to provide the Administrative Office of the U.S. Courts, a support agency for the federal courts, with database management, software and services.

The company said its partner in the contract, which was awarded competitively, is BTG, a privately-held company which specializes in systems engineering, integration and network systems and Internet/intranet/extranet access and services.

Informix, which provides database technology for large corporate and government clients, posted a loss loss of $140.1 million in the first quarter as its revenues fell sharply. The company has been the subject of takeover speculation in the past month.
Shares of Informix were trading at 9- 1/16 early Monday afternoon.
